description: Update documentation to describe the state management feature.

instructions: Locate the relevant sections in `docs/index.md` that describe the runner's capabilities.
Add a new section or update an existing one in `docs/index.md` to clearly explain that the runner now supports state management, allowing tasks to persist their state and resume execution.
Ensure the language in `docs/index.md` is user-friendly and highlights the benefit of this feature.
Locate the relevant sections in `docs/internal_process.md` that describe the runner's architecture and components.
Add a new section or update an existing one in `docs/internal_process.md` to describe the state management implementation.
Explain how state is captured, stored, and loaded.
Briefly mention the location where state files are stored (if applicable and not sensitive).

Reference the State Management RFC (`project_dev/rfc/runner/state-management.md`) and the State Management Design document (`project_dev/in_dev/state-management/state_management_design.md`) within `docs/internal_process.md` for more detailed information.
Review both updated documents (`docs/index.md` and `docs/internal_process.md`) for clarity, accuracy, and consistency with the implemented feature.
constraints: Only modify the specified documentation files (`docs/index.md`, `docs/internal_process.md`).
Do not introduce technical jargon in the user-facing documentation (`docs/index.md`) unless clearly explained.
validation_criteria: The user-facing documentation (`docs/index.md`) includes a clear explanation of the state management capability and its benefits.
The internal documentation (`docs/internal_process.md`) includes a brief description of the state management implementation details.
The internal documentation (`docs/internal_process.md`) includes references to the State Management RFC and Design documents.
The documentation is grammatically correct and easy to understand.
